paragraphs.original: 却说贾母坐起说道：“我到你们家已经六十多年了，从年轻的时候到老来，福也享尽了。自你们老爷起，儿子孙子也都算是好的了。就是宝玉呢，我疼了他一场－－”说到那里，拿眼满地下瞅著。王夫人便推宝玉走到床前。贾母从被窝里伸出手来拉著宝玉，道：“我的儿，你要争气才好！”
paragraphs.english: I have been married to your family for sixty years, from the time when I was young to now that I am old, and I have had a good life. Your father and your son and grandson have all been good too. Even your宝玉, I have loved you too. When she got to this point, she cast a glance around the room. paragraphs.chinese: 我从你们家嫁过来已经六十年了，从年轻到老，福分都享尽了。你父亲和儿子、孙子也都是好的。就是你宝玉，我疼了他一场。说到这个份上，她用眼睛扫视了一圈，王夫人赶紧让宝玉走到床前，她从被窝里伸出胳膊搂住了宝玉，说：“我的儿，你要争气才好啊！”

paragraphs.original: 宝玉嘴里答应，心里一酸，那眼泪便要流下来，又不敢哭，只得站著。听贾母说道：“我想再见一个重孙子，我就安心了。我的兰儿在那里呢？”李纨也推贾兰上去。贾母放了宝玉，拉著贾兰，道：“你母亲是要孝顺的。将来你成了人，也叫你母亲风光风光！－－凤丫头呢？”

paragraphs.original: 凤姐本来站在贾母旁边，赶忙走到跟前，说：“在这里呢。”贾母道：“我的儿，你是太聪明了，将来修修福罢！我也没有修什么，不过心实吃亏。那些吃斋念佛的事我也不大干，就是旧年叫人写了些《金刚经》送送人，不知送完了没有？”凤姐道：“没有呢。”贾母道：“早该施舍完了才好。我们大老爷和珍儿是在外头乐了；最可恶的是史丫头没良心，怎么总不来瞧我！”鸳鸯等明知其故，都不言语。
paragraphs.english:
Wang Xifeng, originally standing by Grandma Jiang, quickly walked to the front and said, "I'm here." Grandma Jiang said, "You're too clever, child. You must cultivate your virtues well in the future. I haven't accumulated much virtue, but I've always been practical in my actions. I'm not very into religious practices, but I did have someone copy the Diamond Sutra last year and send it to others. I wonder if they've been distributed." Wang Xifeng replied, "They haven't been distributed yet." Grandma Jiang said, "It's better to distribute them as soon as possible. Our father and Zhen are out looking for pleasure. The most annoying thing is this girl, Xiangyun. Why hasn't she come to visit me?" Knowing the reason, Quanyang and others did not speak.

This passage describes the scene when Wang Xifeng meets Grandma Jiang. Grandma Jiang praises her for being clever, she has not done much religious practice, just distributed the Diamond Sutra last year and it has not been distributed yet. Grandma Jiang complains that her husband and son are out looking for pleasure, and the most annoying thing is the girl, Xiangyun, who has not come to visit her. Quanyang and others knew about the reason, so they remained silent. The language used is simple and vivid, describing the conversation between Grandma Jiang and Wang Xifeng, reflecting the social风气 and character traits of that time.
paragraphs.chinese:
王熙凤本来站在贾母身边，赶忙走到前面，说：“在这里呢。”贾母道：“你这孩子，也太聪明了，将来可要好好地积福啊！我没有积什么福，不过做事实在。那些吃斋念佛的事，我也不大热衷，只是去年叫人抄了些《金刚经》送给别人，不知送完了没有？”王熙凤道：“没有呢。”贾母道：“早些施舍完了才好。我们大老爷和珍哥在外头寻花问柳；最讨厌的是史湘云这丫头，怎么总不来探望我！”鸳鸯等人知道其中的缘故，都不作声。

这段文字写的是王熙凤见贾母时的情景，贾母夸奖她聪明，贾母没有做什么佛事，只是抄了《金刚经》送人，现在还没有送完。贾母抱怨贾赦和贾珍在外寻花问柳，史湘云这个丫头没有来看望她。鸳鸯等人知道这是王熙凤的家人在外寻花问柳之事，所以都沉默不语。这段话语言朴实，生动地描绘了贾母与王熙凤的对话，反映了当时社会的风气和人物性格。

paragraphs.original: 贾母又瞧了一瞧宝钗，叹了口气，只见脸上发红。贾政知是回光返照，即忙进上参汤。贾母的牙关已经紧了，合了一回眼，又睁著满屋里瞧了一瞧。王夫人宝钗上去，轻轻扶著，邢夫人凤姐等便忙穿衣。地下婆子们已将床安设停当，铺了被褥。听见贾母喉间略一响动，脸变笑容，竟是去了。享年八十三岁。众婆子疾忙停床。
paragraphs.english:
Translation:

Grandmother Jia looked at Baochai again and sighed. She noticed that her complexion was turning red. Knowing that this could be her grandmother's last moments, Jia Zheng immediately brought her some ginseng soup. Grandmother Jia's jaws were clenched tightly, then she closed her eyes and opened them again, looking around. Lady Wang and Baochai approached to gently support her, while Lady邢 and Lady Wang Xifeng hurried to put on their clothes. The servants had already prepared the bed, spreading out the bedding. A noise could be heard from Grandmother Jia's throat, her smile turned serene, and she passed away peacefully. She was 83 years old. The servants swiftly stopped the preparations for the bed.
paragraphs.chinese:
贾母又看了看宝钗，叹了一口气，只见她脸色发红。贾政知道这可能是贾母生命的最后时刻，马上送上参汤。贾母牙关紧闭，闭了一次眼睛又睁开了，环顾四周。王夫人和宝钗上前轻轻扶着她，邢夫人和王熙凤等人急忙穿上衣服。仆人们已经将床铺好，铺上了被褥。贾母喉咙里发出一声响动，脸上的笑容变成了安详，她就这样离世了。享年八十三岁。众仆人迅速停下了床铺的准备工作。

贾母又望了宝钗一眼，长叹了一声，只见她的脸色开始变红。贾政知道这是母亲生命垂危的迹象，立刻为她送上人参汤。贾母的牙关紧闭，闭了眼又睁开，目光在屋里环视一周。王夫人和宝钗上前轻轻扶着她，而邢夫人、王熙凤等人则赶紧穿上衣服。仆人们已经布置好了床铺，并铺上了被褥。随后，贾母喉咙里发出微弱的声响，脸上露出安详的笑容，然后安静地离世了。她享年八十三岁。众仆人迅速停止了整理床铺的工作。

paragraphs.original: 于是贾政等在外一边跪著，邢夫人等在内一边跪著，一齐举起哀来。外面家人各样预备齐全，只听里头信儿一传出来，从荣府大门起至内宅门，扇扇大开，一色净白纸糊了；孝棚高起，大门前的牌楼立时竖起；上下人等登时成服。
paragraphs.english: At this time, Jia Zheng and the others were kneeling in front of the door, while her husband and the rest were kneeling inside, crying at the top of their voices. All the preparations for mourning had been completed at home. As soon as the news was passed inside, all the corridors of the Rong Family Manor from the main gate to the inner gates were covered with white paper. The mourning platform was built, and the memorial arch was erected in front of the main gate. All the servants and staff immediately donned their mourning garments.
paragraphs.chinese: 这时贾政等人在门外跪着，邢夫人等人在门内跪着，一齐放声大哭。外面的人家把各项准备都安排好了。只听里头一传出消息，荣国府从大门起至内宅门，一色都糊了白纸；孝棚建好了，大门前的牌楼竖立起来；上下人等立刻穿起丧服。

paragraphs.original: 贾政报了丁忧，礼部奏闻。主上深仁厚泽：念及世代功勋，又系元妃祖母，赏银一千两，谕礼部主祭。家人们各处报丧。众亲友虽知贾家势败，今见圣恩隆重，都来探丧。择了吉时成殓，停灵正寝。
paragraphs.english:
Jia Zheng received the notice of his official mourning from the rites department, which then reported it to the emperor. As the emperor considered the Jia family's long history of service, and because Empress Yuan Fei's grandmother was the emperor's mother, he issued an imperial edict rewarding the Jia family with one thousand taels of silver, and commanded the rites department to arrange the memorial services. News of the family's downfall spread. Even though friends and relatives knew the Jia family's decline, they were now surprised to hear of the emperor's great generosity, and they came to pay their respects. After choosing a lucky time for the burial, the body was laid to rest in the main chamber of the house.

The following is a translation of the passage you provided:

Jia Zheng, upon receiving the official notification of his period of mourning (a mourning period following the death of a close relative), passed this information on to the Rites Department. The department then proceeded to report this to the emperor. Considering the long-standing contributions of the Jia family and the fact that Empress Yuan Fei, who was the emperor's grandmother, was a relative of the current ruling family, the emperor issued an edict to award the Jia family with a sum of one thousand taels of silver. This decision was further accompanied by an instruction to the Rites Department to manage the funeral rites and memorial services. News of the family's situation spread, and despite the declining fortunes of the Jia household, friends and relatives came to pay their respects, demonstrating the respect and influence that the Jia family still held in society.

After selecting an auspicious time for the burial, the deceased was then laid to rest in the main chamber of the residence, traditionally known as the "正寝" (zhèng xǐng), which was considered a fitting place for honoring the deceased.

This account paints a picture of a bureaucratic process governed by protocol and tradition, intertwined with the personal influence and political power within the imperial court and the wider society. It highlights the complex social dynamics that existed during this time period in Chinese history.
paragraphs.chinese: 贾政接到丁忧的文书，礼部就上报给皇帝。皇帝念贾家的世代功劳，加上元妃是当今皇后的祖母，就特批赏银一千两，并命令礼部办理祭祀事宜。家里人四处报丧。亲朋好友虽然知道了贾家的势败，现在见皇帝的恩典如此隆重，都来探丧。选了吉利的时辰安葬，停灵在正寝里。

paragraphs.original: 贾赦不在家，贾政为长；宝玉、贾环、贾兰是亲孙，年纪又小，都应守灵。贾琏虽也是亲孙，带著贾蓉，尚可分派家人办事。虽请了些男女外亲来照应，内里邢王二夫人、李纨、凤姐、宝钗等是应灵旁哭泣的。尤氏虽可照应，他自贾珍外出，依住荣府，一向总不上前，且又荣府的事不甚谙练。贾蓉的媳妇更不必说。惜春年小，虽在这里长的，他于家事全不知道。－－所以内里竟无一人支持。只有凤姐可以照管里头的事，况又贾琏在外作主，里外他二人，倒也相宜。
paragraphs.english: Jia Shai was not at home, so it was the eldest son of the eldest branch of the Jia clan, Jia Zhen, who was in charge. As for the three Jia Bing, Jia Huan, and Jia Lan, they were all his own biological grandsons, and as they were young, they were the ones who would be in charge of the mourning. While Jia Lian was also a biological grandson, he had Jia Rong under his care, so he could delegate his duties to his own servants. He had invited some male and female relatives to help out, but among them, only the two ladies, Lady Xing and Lady Wang, Li Wan, Feng Ji, and Bao Chao were the ones who would be by the tomb weeping. While You Yu could help out, she had moved to the荣府 after her husband, Jia Zhen, had left home, and she didn't participate much in the affairs of the Jia family. As for Jia Rong's wife, she was not worth mentioning. Xiao Chun was young and had grown up in the Jia family, but she knew nothing about household affairs. As a result, there was no one inside who could lend support. Only Feng Ji was capable of managing the internal affairs, and since Jia Lian was in charge outside, the two of them worked well together.
paragraphs.chinese: 贾赦不在家，贾政是长房长孙。宝玉、贾环、贾兰是嫡亲孙子，年纪又小，应守灵。贾琏虽然也是嫡亲孙子，带着贾蓉，可以分派家人办事。虽请了些男女亲戚来照应，内里邢、王两夫人、李纨、凤姐、宝钗等是应灵旁哭泣的。尤氏虽可照应，他自贾珍外出后就住到荣府，一向很少上前，对荣府的事也不甚谙练。贾蓉的媳妇更不必说。惜春年纪小，虽然在这长大，但对家事全然不知。所以内里竟无一人支持。只有凤姐可以照管里头的事，况且又由贾琏在外作主，里外他二人倒也相宜。

paragraphs.original: 凤姐先前仗著自己的才干，原打量老太太死了，他大有一番作用。邢王二夫人等本知他曾办过秦氏的事，必是妥当，于是仍叫凤姐总理里头的事。凤姐本不应辞，自然应了，心想：“这里的事本是我管的。那些家人更是我手下的人。太太和珍大嫂子的人本来难使唤，如今他们都去了。银项虽没有对牌，这宗银子却是现成的。外头的事又是我们那个办。虽说我现今身子不好，想来也不致落褒贬，必比宁府里还得办些。”心下已定，且待明日接了三，后日一早分派。便叫周瑞家的传出话去，将“花名册”取上来。
paragraphs.english:
Just before her death, Lady Jia wanted to take the chance to impress the others, to parade her powers. For she had been responsible for Qian Keqing's business affairs, and knew that she was capable and skillful, so the Lady Wang and Lady Xing still entrusted her to manage the household. Wang didn't want to take on the responsibility, but she couldn't refuse. She thought that, anyway, she was in charge of the household, so she would also take care of the servants and maids. There was only she who could handle matters in the Rong Mansion. Even though she was sick, she could still go on with her work, better than in the Ning Mansion. 

So, she ordered Zhou Wei to bring the register of the servants, planning to start reorganizing the staff the next day.
paragraphs.chinese:
贾母死前，王熙凤本想好好表现一番，借机出出风头。因她管过秦可卿的事，知道她办事妥帖，所以王夫人和邢夫人仍让她当管家。王熙凤本不想接这个活，但又无法推辞，心想反正我当家管事，这些丫鬟和仆人都是我管的，荣府里的事，也只有我能办。我身体虽然不好，但我还能继续办下去，总比宁府里强。

接着，她让周瑞家的把“花名册”拿来，打算第二天接班后就开始分派工作。

paragraphs.original: 凤姐一一的瞧了，统共男仆只有二十一人，女仆只有十九人，馀者俱是些丫头，连各房算上，也不过三十多人，难以派差。心里想道：“这回老太太的事倒没有东府里的人多。”又将庄上的弄出几个，也不敷差遣。正在思算，只见一个小丫头过来说：“鸳鸯姐姐请奶奶。”凤姐只得过去。只见鸳鸯哭得泪人一般，一把拉著凤姐儿，说道：“二奶奶请坐，我给二奶奶磕个头。虽说服中不行礼，这个头是要磕的！”鸳鸯说著跪下，慌的凤姐赶忙拉住，说道：“这是什么礼？有话好好的说！”鸳鸯跪著，凤姐便拉起来。鸳鸯说道：“老太太的事，一应内外，都是二爷和二奶奶办。这宗银子是老太太留下的。老太太这一辈子也没有糟蹋过什么银钱，如今临了这件大事，必得求二奶奶体体面面的办一办才好！我方才听见老爷说什么‘诗云子曰’，我也不懂；又说什么‘丧与其易，宁戚’，我更不明白。我问宝二奶奶，说是老爷的意思：老太太的丧事，只要悲切才是真孝，不必糜费，图好看的念头。我想老太太这样一个人，怎么不该体面些？我虽是奴才丫头，敢说什么？只是老太太疼二奶奶和我这一场，临死了还不叫他风光风光？我想二奶奶是能办大事的，故此，我请二奶奶来，求作个主意！我生是跟老太太的人，老太太死了，我也是跟老太太的！若是瞧不见老太太的事怎么办，将来怎么见老太太呢？”
paragraphs.english:
Translated:

The Countess Feng examined them one by one; she found that there were only 21 male servants and 19 female servants in total, with the rest being maids. Altogether, there were merely more than thirty people, not enough to assign duties. She pondered, "The late mistress’s funeral affairs are handled by the masters of the Eastern Mansion. They outnumber us here." She also considered asking from the farm, but there weren’t enough to distribute among them. As she was thinking about this, a young servant girl came over and said, "Big Sister Yingying invites you, Lady Feng." Lady Feng was forced to go. She saw that Yingying was crying, her face was tearstained, and she pulled Lady Feng to her side. "Please have a seat, Madam. I’m going to prostrate myself to you. Even though the mourning period forbids us from performing the rites, I still need to prostrate myself!" Yingying said as she knelt down. Lady Feng hurriedly held her, saying, "What’s the meaning of this? Talk normally!" Yingying was kneeling as Lady Feng pulled her up. She said, "Master and Madam Feng are the ones who handle the late mistress’s funeral affairs on both inside and outside. These silver pieces are left by the late mistress. She never wasted a coin in her lifetime, so this last major affair must be handled with care and respect. I heard Master mention some words from 'Poem and Sayings', which I don’t understand. He also mentioned, 'A funeral should be simpler rather than focusing on the grief.' I don’t understand this either. I asked Miss Second Master, and she said that Master meant the funeral of the late mistress should be about grief, not extravagance. I’m thinking, how could a person like the late mistress not be treated respectfully? As a servant, what can I say? But the late mistress cared for both of us. How is it that she didn’t make us look good when she passed away? I believe that Madam Feng can handle such matters. That’s why I invited you here, and I’m seeking your leadership! I’m someone who serves the late mistress, so when she’s gone, I’m serving her as well! If I don’t see this funeral through, how can I face the late mistress in the future?"
paragraphs.chinese: 凤姐儿一一的瞧过，总共男仆只有21人，女仆只有19人，剩余的都是丫鬟，合计加起来也不过三十多个人，不足以分配差事。心里琢磨着：“这次老太太的丧事，东府里的人比这边多。”又从庄子上弄来几个，也不够分配。正在思考，只见一个小丫头过来对凤姐说：“鸳鸯姐姐请奶奶。”凤姐只得过去。只见鸳鸯哭得泪人一样，一把拉着凤姐，说：“二奶奶请坐，我给二奶奶磕个头。虽然服丧期间不行礼，这个头是要磕的！”鸳鸯说着跪下，慌的凤姐赶忙拉住，说：“这是什么礼？有什么事情好好说！”鸳鸯跪着，凤姐便拉她起来。鸳鸯说：“老太太的丧事，内外都是二爷和二奶奶操办的。这些银子是老太太留下的。老太太一辈子没有糟蹋过钱，如今这最后一场大事，必须要二奶奶用心体面地办一办才好！我刚才听见老爷说什么‘诗云子曰’，我也不懂；又说什么‘丧与其易，宁戚’，我更不明白。我问宝二奶奶，说是老爷的意思：老太太的丧事，关键在于悲痛，不必浪费，不要想着好看。我想老太太这样一个人，怎么不该体面些呢？我虽然只是奴才丫头，敢说什么？只是老太太疼爱二奶奶和我这一场，临死的时候怎么不叫她风光风光呢？我想二奶奶是能办大事的，所以，我请二奶奶来，求二奶奶做主！我生是跟老太太的人，老太太死了，我也是跟老太太的！若是看不到老太太的丧事怎么办，将来怎么见老太太呢？”

paragraphs.original: 凤姐听了这话来的古怪，便说：“你放心，要体面是不难的。虽是老爷口说要省，那势派也错不得。便拿这项银子都花在老太太身上，也是该当的。”鸳鸯道：“老太太的遗言说，所有剩下的东西是给我们的，二奶奶倘或用著不够，只管拿这个去折变补上。就是老爷说什么，也不好违了老大太的遗言。况且老太太分派的时候，不是老爷在这里听见的么？”凤姐道：“你素来最明白的，怎么这会子这样的著急起来了？”鸳鸯道：“不是我著急，为的是大太太是不管事的，老爷是怕招摇的。若是二奶奶心里也是老爷的想头，说抄过家的人家，丧事还是这么好，将来又要抄起来，也就不顾起老太太来，怎么样呢？我呢，是个丫头，好歹碍不著，到底是这里的声名！”凤姐道：“我知道了。你只管放心，有我呢。”鸳鸯千恩万谢的托了凤姐。
paragraphs.english: Lady Wang Xifeng was taken aback by this, as it sounded strange. "Don't worry. It won't be hard to maintain dignity. Even though the Master wants us to be frugal, we still need to maintain our dignity. You can spend all of this money on my grandmother if you wish." Chuan Yang replied, "My grandmother mentioned in her will that the rest of the property was for us. If you don't use it all, you can pawn some of it to make up for any shortage. You should not disregard the Master's wishes. After all, she didn't say this to the Master." Lady Wang Xifeng asked, "You're always so sensible, why are you so agitated now?" Chuan Yang answered, "I'm not worried about it, I'm worried that the Madam doesn't want to do anything. The Master doesn't want any trouble. If you have the same thoughts as the Master, what if you want to save the family from going bankrupt, but still want to arrange a grand funeral for my grandmother? This would also lead to us ignoring my grandmother's wishes. What then? I'm just a servant, and I don't really matter. But I'm worried that this would tarnish our reputation." Lady Wang Xifeng said, "I understand. Don't worry. I'll take care of it." Chuan Yang thanked her profusely before handing the task over to Lady Wang Xifeng.
paragraphs.chinese: 王熙凤听了这话，觉得有些古怪，于是说：“放心吧，要体面可不难办，虽然老爷说要省一点，但排场也是不能省的。哪怕您拿这些银子全花在老太太身上，也是应该的。”鸳鸯说：“老太太的遗言里说过，剩下的东西都是给我们的，奶奶用不够，可以拿这些东西去当掉，换点钱补上。就是老爷怎么说，也不能违背了老太大的遗言。况且您也知道，老太大的话，不是当着老爷说的么？”王熙凤说：“你一向最明白，怎么这会子这么着急了？”鸳鸯说：“不是我着急，我是怕大太太不管事，老爷怕惹事，如果奶奶也是老爷的想头，说抄过家的人家，丧事也这么排场，将来又要抄起来，也就不顾老太太了，怎么办呢？我是奴仆，好歹也碍不着事，只是怕坏了这里的名声。”王熙凤说：“我知道了，你只管放心，有我呢。”鸳鸯千恩万谢地托付给了王熙凤。

paragraphs.original: 那凤姐出来，想道：“鸳鸯这东西好古怪！不知打了什么主意？论理，老太太身上本该体面些，－－嗳！且别管他，只按著偺们家先前的样子办去。”于是叫旺儿家的来，把话传出去，请二爷进来。
paragraphs.english: Wang Xifeng came out and thought, "What an odd child, Qinyang! I wonder what’s going on in that head of hers? She should know that, at her age, it’s the thing to do to dress up the old lady in all her finery and keep her looking her best. Forget it, then. We’ll just stick to the old rules in our family." So she sent Wang Er to tell Jialan that she could come in.
paragraphs.chinese: 这里王熙凤出来，想道：“鸳鸯这孩子好古怪！不知心里打的什么算盘？按理说，老太太这么大年纪了，应该在仪容上体面体面才是。嗨！不管他，只按我们家原先的老规矩办就行了。”于是叫旺儿家的过来，把话传给贾琏，让他进来。

paragraphs.original: 不多时，贾琏进来说道：“怎么找我？你在里头照应著些就是了。横竖作主是老爷太太们，他说怎么著，我们就怎么著。”凤姐道：“你也说起这个话来了，可不是鸳鸯说的话应验了么？”贾琏道：“什么鸳鸯的话？”凤姐便将鸳鸯请进去的话述了一遍。贾琏道：“他们的话算什么！刚才二老爷叫我去，说：‘老太太的事固要认真办理，但是知道的呢，说是老太太自己结果自己；不知道的，只说偺们都隐匿起来了，如今很宽裕。老太太的这宗银子用不了，谁还要么？仍旧该用在老太太身上。老太太是在南边的，虽有坟地，却没有阴宅。老太太的灵是要归到南边去的。留这银子在祖坟上盖起些房屋来，再馀下的，置买几顷祭田。偺们回去也好；就是不回去，便叫那些贫穷族中住著，也好按时按节，早晚上香，时常祭扫祭扫。’你想这些话可不是正经主意么？据你的话，难道都花了罢？”
paragraphs.english: It was not long before Jialin came in, saying, "Why did you summon me?" "Look after everything here," said Lady Feng, "the masters and mistresses are in charge. Do as they say." Lady Feng said, "Isn't that just like what Quanyang said?" "What did Quanyang say?" asked Jialin. Lady Feng told him what Quanyang had said. Jialin said, "What they say doesn't matter! Uncle has just summoned me, and said, 'This is an important matter, and the rumors about it say that it is the result of the old lady taking care of herself. There are also rumors that people have hidden away the treasure here at the estate. The estate is very well off. If the old lady doesn't need all this treasure, who will need it? This treasure should be used for the old lady. The old lady is now in the south. There are graves but no place for her to rest in the earth. The old lady's soul has to return to the south. This treasure should be used to build some houses for the old lady to rest in, and then any that is left over could be used to buy some fields for the sacrifices. When we return, we would have something to live on; if we do not return, let the poorer members of the clan take care of it, so that they can pray and clean the graves at the appropriate times.' "Don't all these things seem like sensible ideas? Do you really think that all the treasure will be spent?"
paragraphs.chinese: 不多时，贾琏进来，说：“找我干什么？你在里头照应着，主事的是老爷太太们，怎么着都听他们的。”凤姐说：“你这话不正应了鸳鸯说的话吗？”贾琏说：“什么鸳鸯的话？”凤姐便把鸳鸯来请进去的话说了一遍。贾琏说：“他们的话算什么！刚才二老爷叫我过去，说：‘老太太的事要认真办理，但人们传说着是老太太自己结果自己；又传说着说是这府里的人隐匿起来了，如今府里很宽裕。老太太的这宗银子用不了，谁还要呢？这些银子应当用在老太太身上。老太太现在南边，虽有坟地，却没有阴宅。老太太的灵是要归到南边去的。留这银子在祖坟上盖起些房屋来，再剩下的，置买几顷祭田。我们回去也好；就是不回去，便叫那些贫穷族中住著，也好按时按节，早晚上香，时常祭扫祭扫。’你说这些话不都是正经主意吗？按你说的，难道都花了不成？”

paragraphs.original: 凤姐道：“银子发出来了没有？”贾琏道：“谁见过银子？我听见偺们太太听见了二老爷的话，极力的撺掇二太太和二老爷说：‘这是好主意！’叫我怎么著？现在外头棚杠上要支几百银子，这会子还没有发出来。我要去，他们都说有，先叫外头办了，回来再算。你想，这些奴才，有钱的早溜了。按著册子叫去，有说告病的，有说下庄子去了的。剩下几个走不动的，只有赚钱的能耐，还有赔钱的本事么？”凤姐听了，呆了半天，说道：“这还办什么！”
paragraphs.english: 在翻译时，需要确保准确理解原文的上下文以及每个词汇的准确用法，以保证翻译的准确性和流畅性。在这里，关键在于理解“听见”和“知道”的区别，以及上下文如何影响翻译的正确性。因此，翻译为：“凤姐问贾琏：“银子发下去了吗？”贾琏回答：“我听说二太太知道了二老爷的话，极力劝说二太太和二爷说：‘这个主意很好！’我该怎么办呢？现在外面需要用棚杠的人需要几百两银子，可是银子还没发下去。我要去，他们都说有了，先叫外面去办，回来再算。你想想，这些奴才，有钱的早就溜了。按着名单叫他们去，有的说生病了，有的说下庄子去了。剩下几个不想走的，只会赚钱，赔钱的本事就没有了吗？”凤姐听了半天，只是发呆，说道：“这还办什么！””这个翻译更准确地反映了原文的意思，并且在英语表达中使用了适当的词序和语法结构。
paragraphs.chinese:
凤姐问贾琏：“银子发下去了吗？”贾琏答道：“哪儿见得了银子？就说我听见二奶奶听见老爷的话，就极力劝着二奶奶和二爷说：‘这个主意好！’叫我怎么办？现在外面用棚杠的人要用几百两银子，可这银子还没发下去。我要去，他们都说有，先叫外面去办，回来再算。你想想，这些奴才，有钱的早就溜了。按着册子叫他们去，有的说告病，有的说下庄子去了。剩下几个不想走的，只有赚钱的能耐，还有赔钱的本事吗？”凤姐听了半天，只是发呆，说道：“办不办都一样！”

（“谁见过银子？”“我听见偺们太太听见了二老爷的话”云云，误作“我听见二太太听见了二老爷的话”）

凤姐问贾琏：“银子发下去了吗？”贾琏说：“我哪儿见过银子？我就听说二太太听到了二老爷的话，极力地撺掇二太太和二爷说，这是个好主意。这我该怎么办？现在外面要用棚杠，要几百两银子，可是银子还没发下去。我要去，他们都说有了，先叫外面办了，回来再算。你想想，这些奴才，有钱的都溜了。按着名单叫他们去，有的说病了，有的说下庄子去了。剩下几个没走的，只会赚钱，赔钱可就不行了。”凤姐听了半天，只是发呆，然后说：“这还办什么！”

凤姐问贾琏：“银子发下去了吗？”贾琏说：“我都没见过银子！我听说二太太听见了二老爷的话，极力怂恿二太太和二爷说，这是个好主意。我该怎么办呢？现在外面需要用棚杠，要几百两银子，可是银子还没发下去。我要去，他们都说有了，先叫外面去办了，回来再算。想想这些奴才，有钱的早就跑了。按照名单叫他们去，有的说病了，有的说下庄子去了。剩下几个不想走的，只会赚钱，赔钱可就不行了。”凤姐听了半天，只是发呆，然后说：“这还办什么！”

“听”字句中的“听”当指“听见”之意，用来表达“知道”、“了解”之意。“听见”为动词，“知道”为“听说”，而非“听见”。 “听见”是耳朵所闻的，是通过听觉获取信息的过程。“听说”则是通过语言、信息、传闻等渠道获取信息的过程，其中的“听”是指接受到信息，而非实际的听觉过程。因此，正确的句子应该是：“凤姐问贾琏：“银子发下去了吗？”贾琏答道：“我听说二太太听见了二老爷的话，极力的撺掇二太太和二爷说：‘这是好主意！’叫我怎么著？”现在外面棚杠上要支几百银子，这会子还没有发出来。我要去，他们都说有，先叫外头办了，回来再算。你想，这些奴才，有钱的早溜了。按著册子叫去，有说告病的，有说下庄子去了的。剩下几个走不动的，只有赚钱的能耐，还有赔钱的本事么？”凤姐听了，呆了半天，说道：“这还办什么！”

“听见”在句子中使用时，通常跟有一个具体的动作或情境，表示通过这个动作或情境得知了某个信息。例如，“听见了二老爷的话”表示是通过听二老爷所说的话得知了信息，而不是直接通过听觉器官听见了声音。因此，上下文中“听见”和“知道”在含义上有区别，不能互换。在这种情况下，正确的表述应该是使用“知道”或者“听说”，而不是“听见”。这可以避免混淆语义，使得句子更准确地传达了信息。

paragraphs.original: 正说著，见来了一个丫头，说：“大太太的话，问二奶奶：今儿第三天了，里头还很乱，供了饭，还叫亲戚们等著吗？叫了半天，上了菜，短了饭：这是什么办事的道理？”凤姐急忙进去吆喝人来伺候，将就著把早饭打发了。偏偏那日人来的多，里头的人都死眉瞪眼的。凤姐只得在那里照料了一会子，又惦记著派人，赶著出来，叫了旺儿家的传齐了家下女人们，一一分派了。众人都答应著不动。凤姐道：“什么时候？还不供饭？”众人道：“传饭是容易的，只要将里头的东西发出来，我们才好照管去。”凤姐道：“糊涂东西！派定了你们，少不得有的。”众人只得勉强应著。
paragraphs.english: And as she spoke, a little maid came in, saying: "Madam, your words. Please let Madam go. Today is the third day, and the inn is still in a mess. They have served food. Why are they waiting for the relatives to eat? We called a long time, but only now has the food been served upstairs and not the food downstairs. What is the proper way to handle this?" Quickly, the Countess entered the inner quarters, calling out to the servants to attend to her. She ate haphazardly, the morning meal. That day, there were many people, and the inn was busy. The Countess had to manage the situation for a while, and then sent people out to handle things. All the people agreed, but did not act. The Countess said, "What time is it? Why hasn't the food been served?" The people all said, "Serving food is easy, but we have to distribute the things inside first. Then we can distribute them." The Countess said, "Blindly saying that! You distribute, naturally there will be some." They could only reluctantly agree.
paragraphs.chinese: 说着，只见一个小丫头进来，说：“大奶奶的话，请二奶奶去：今日是第三天，里边还很乱，已经供了饭，还等亲戚们来吃吗？叫了半天，上面才上菜，下面却短了饭。这是什么办事道理？”凤姐急忙进内去，吆喝人来伺候。将就着把早饭打发了。偏偏那日来的人多，里边的人一个个都没精神。凤姐只得在那里照应了一会子，又分派了些人出去。众人都答应著，就是不动。凤姐说：“什么时候了，还不供饭？”众人都说：“传饭容易，只要把里边的东西分发出来，我们才好分派。”凤姐说：“瞎说！你们既然分派了，自然要有的。”众人才勉强答应著。

paragraphs.original: 凤姐即往上房去取发应用之物，要去请示邢王二夫人，见人多难说，看那时候已经日渐平西了，只得找了鸳鸯，说要老太太存的那一分家伙。鸳鸯道：“你还问我呢！那一年二爷当了，赎了来了么？”凤姐道：“不用银的金的，只要那一分平常使的。”鸳鸯道：“大太太珍大奶奶屋里使的是那里来的？”凤姐一想不差，转身就走，只得到王夫人那边找了玉钏彩云，才拿了一分出来，急忙叫彩明登账，发与众人收管。
paragraphs.english: Jia was about to go to the main house to fetch things to use, but not wishing to speak before a large crowd, she went instead to ask Yingying about the things stored in the old lady’s room. "How can you ask me?" Yingying replied. "That year Erhun became an official, was that set of things brought back?" Thinking about it, Jia realized that Yingying was right. She turned around and went to Lady Wang’s chambers, fetching Yuanchuan and Caiyun, and with that she managed to get her hands on the set of things. She hurriedly instructed Caiming to take an inventory and distribute the things among the servants to be looked after.
paragraphs.chinese: 凤姐立刻到上房去取用的东西，本来打算去向邢、王二位夫人报告，看到人多不便说话，看看天色已经很晚，只好找鸳鸯询问老太太存的那一套家伙。鸳鸯说：“你还问我呢！那一年二爷当了官，那一套东西赎回来了没有？”凤姐一想，鸳鸯说的不错，立刻转身去王夫人那边找玉钏、彩云，才拿到了那一套用的东西，急忙叫彩明登账，把东西分发给众人保管。

paragraphs.original: 鸳鸯见凤姐这样慌张，又不好叫他回来，心想：“他头里作事，何等爽利周到！如今怎么掣肘的这个样儿？我看这两三天连一点头脑都没有，不是老太太白疼了他了吗？”那里知邢夫人一听贾政的话，正合著将来家计艰难的心，巴不得留一点子作个收局。况且老太太的事原是长房作主。贾赦虽不在家，贾政又是拘泥的人，有件事便说：“请大太太的主意。”邢夫人素知凤姐手脚大，贾琏的闹鬼，所以死拿住不放松。鸳鸯只道已将这项银两交了出去了，故见凤姐掣肘如此，却疑为不肯用心，便在贾母灵前唠唠叨叨哭个不了。
paragraphs.english: YuanYang, seeing JiaJing so worried, not knowing what to do, thought: "Why is she so hesitant now, when she usually acts so quickly and smoothly? I see that she's been listless these past few days, so I've spoiled her. Was it for nothing?" She didn't know that when she heard JiaMing's words, she was exactly thinking of her future plans for the family's decline, and was delighted that she was going to leave a little for future use. Moreover, it had always been the first family that had the say in managing the old lady's estate, and JiaShai was not at home, and JiaJing was a very careful person, so he said, "Let's ask the first wife to make a decision." JiaYing had always known that JiaJing was a lavish spender, and JiaLan was a wastrel, so she clung to them. YuanYang thought that the silver had been handed over, and seeing JiaJing's hesitation, she wept at the tomb of the old lady.
paragraphs.chinese: 鸳鸯见凤姐这样慌张，又不好叫她回来，心想：“她平素做事多利索周到，为什么现在做事这样迟疑不决呢？我看她这几日一点精神都没有，白疼了她，不是白疼了吗？”哪里知道邢夫人一听贾政的话，正好应了她将来家道衰落的打算，巴不得留下一点子为将来的收局做准备。况且老太太的事原是由长房做主，贾赦虽不在家，贾政又是一个拘谨的人，说：“请大太太做主。”邢夫人素来知道凤姐花钱大方，贾琏又是个败家子，所以死抓着不放手。鸳鸯以为这项银两已交出去了，见凤姐现在做事迟疑不决，便在贾母灵前哭个不停。

paragraphs.original: 邢夫人等听了话中有话，不想到自己不令凤姐便宜行事，反说：“凤丫头果然有些不用心！”王夫人到了晚上，叫了凤姐过来，说：“偺们家虽说不济，外头的体面是要的。这两三天人来人往，我瞧著那些人都照应不到，想必你没有吩咐。－－还得你替我们操点心儿才好！”凤姐听了，呆了一会，要将银两不凑手的话说出来，但只银钱是外头管的，王夫人说的是照应不到。凤姐也不敢辩，只好不言语。邢夫人在旁说道：“论理，该是我们做媳妇的操心，本不是孙子媳妇的事，但是我们动不得身，所以托你。你是打不得撒手的！”
paragraphs.english: Xing Lady heard what the Lady of the House said and realized that she hadn't given her permission to do as she pleased. She felt unhappy. Lady Wang found Lady of the House in the evening, saying that although there was a bit of tightness in the household, face-saving matters were still important. With so many people coming and going recently, she felt that the household couldn't be taken care of properly, perhaps because Lady of the House hadn't given clear instructions. Lady Wang hoped that Lady of the House could pay more attention to the household affairs. Upon hearing this, Lady of the House felt a bit uncomfortable, as the money was under her management. She didn't dare to argue with Lady Wang, who said the household couldn't be taken care of properly, and so she remained silent. Xing Lady, standing on the side, said that these matters were supposed to be taken care of by the wife, but since they couldn't move, they had entrusted them to Lady of the House. Lady of the House couldn't just let it go.
paragraphs.chinese: 邢夫人听了凤姐的话，想到自己没有让她便宜行事，心里不高兴。王夫人晚上找到凤姐，说家里虽然有点紧巴，但面子上的事还是要做的。最近来来往往的人那么多，她觉得家里的人都照顾不过来，是不是凤姐没吩咐清楚。王夫人希望凤姐能多操心家里的事情。凤姐听了，有些为难，因为银钱是她管的，王夫人说的是照顾不过来，凤姐不敢辩解，只能保持沉默。邢夫人在一旁说，家里这些事本来是做媳妇的该操心的，但现在她们动不了身，所以才托付给凤姐，凤姐不能撒手不管啊。

paragraphs.original: 凤姐紫涨了脸，正要回说，只听外头鼓乐一奏，是烧黄昏纸的时候了，大家举起哀来，又不得说。凤姐原想回来再说，王夫人催他出去料理，说道：“这里有我们呢，你快快儿的去料理明儿的事罢。”
paragraphs.english:
1. Lady Feng's face turned crimson as she was about to speak when she heard the drum and gong music playing outside. It was time to burn incense for their elders at dusk. They all burst into grief-stricken sobs, and Lady Feng could only restrain her sorrow and step out to attend to the affairs of the day after tomorrow. Lady Feng had intended to return later to continue, but Lady Wang urged her to hurry and attend to the affairs of the day after tomorrow. She said that they would handle things here and told her to go quickly.

2. Lady Feng's cheeks flushed scarlet as she was on the verge of uttering a word when she suddenly heard the sound of drums and gongs. The ritual of burning incense for their elders at dusk was about to begin. In response, they all broke into heart-rending sobs. Lady Feng, compelled by her sense of duty, had no choice but to hold back her grief and leave to attend to the arrangements for the next day. She had planned to continue later, but Lady Wang insisted she quickly attend to the affairs of the day after tomorrow, assuring her that they would handle the remaining tasks. 

3. The flush rose to Lady Feng's cheeks as she was about to speak. She had just heard the drumming and the gong signaling that it was time to burn paper offerings for their elders at dusk. They all burst into tears of sorrow. Lady Feng could only contain her sorrow, put on a brave face, and step out to take care of the arrangements for the day after tomorrow. She had intended to continue later on, but Lady Wang urged her to hurry, telling her that they could handle things here and she should go quickly.

4. Lady Feng's face flushed as she was about to say something, when suddenly she heard the rhythmic beating of drums and the clanging of gongs from outside. It was the custom to burn incense and paper for their elders around dusk. They all began to weep bitterly. Lady Feng, despite her grief, had no choice but to push down her sorrow and leave to handle the matters of the day after tomorrow. She had planned to speak again later, but Lady Wang urged her to hurry up and attend to the affairs of the day after tomorrow, saying that they would take care of things here and that she should go quickly. 

5. Lady Feng's face turned red as she was in the middle of speaking, when the music of drums and gongs from outside reached her ears. It was the time to burn offerings for their elders at dusk. They all started to weep in anguish. Lady Feng could not help but suppress her sorrow and leave to manage the tasks for the day after tomorrow. She had planned to continue later, but Lady Wang insisted that she should go quickly to handle the affairs of the day after tomorrow, assuring her that they would take care of the rest.
paragraphs.chinese: 凤姐的脸涨得通红，正要说话，只见外面奏起鼓乐声来，是在为长辈烧黄昏纸了，于是大家放声痛哭，凤姐也只得强忍悲痛先出去料理后天的事情。凤姐本来打算回来再说，被王夫人催促着赶紧去料理后天的事情，说这里交给我们了，你快去吧。

paragraphs.original: 凤姐不敢再言，只得含悲忍泣的出来，又叫人传齐了众人，又吩咐了一会，说：“大娘婶子们可怜我罢！我上头捱了好些话，为的是你们不齐截，叫人笑话，明儿你们豁出些辛苦来罢！”那些人回道：“奶奶办事，不是今儿个一遭儿了，我们敢违拗吗？只是这回的事，上头过于累赘！只说打发这顿饭罢：有在这里吃的，有要在家里吃的；请了这位太太，又是那位奶奶不来。诸如此类，那里能齐全？还求奶奶劝劝那些姑娘们少挑饬就好了。”凤姐道：“头一层是老太太的丫头们是难缠的，太太们的也难说话，叫我说谁去呢？”众人道：“从前奶奶在东府里还是署事，要打要骂，怎么那样锋利？谁敢不依？如今这些姑娘们都压不住了？”凤姐叹道：“东府里的事，虽说托办的，太太虽在那里，不好意思说什么。如今是自己的事情，又是公中的，人人说得话。再者，外头的银钱也叫不灵：即如棚里要一件东西，传出去了，总不见拿进来，这叫我什么法儿呢？”众人道：“二爷在外头，倒怕不应付么？”凤姐道：“还提这个！他也是那里为难。第一件，银钱不在他手里，要一件得回一件，那里凑手？”众人道：“老太太这项银子不在二爷手里么？”凤姐道：“你们回来问管事的就知道了。”众人道：“怨不得！我们听见外头男人抱怨说：这么件大事，偺们一点摸不著，净当苦差，叫人怎么能齐心呢？”
paragraphs.english: Xiongfeng dared not say more, and with tears streaming down her face, she left reluctantly. Gathering the crowd together again, she explained further: "Ladies, please be kind to me. I've had quite a lot of trouble up there. Because you all weren't here to help, I've been the laughingstock. Please try a little harder tomorrow." The others replied, "Madam, you've done so much for us before. We would never not listen. The only thing is that the requests are so detailed. For instance, some want to eat here, some want to go home. Please try to persuade the young ladies to not be too picky." Xiongfeng said, "The hardest part is dealing with the servants of the old lady, and even more so the ladies of the house. What should I do?" The others said, "When you were in the East Mansion, you were just an assistant, so when you ordered, who dared to defy you? Now the young ladies are too hard to manage." Xiongfeng sighed and said, "Things in the East Mansion were different. Though it was my responsibility, the lady would not want to say much because it wasn't her own business. Now, this is my own affairs and as a public official, everyone has the right to speak their mind. Moreover, the outside funds are hard to manage. For example, I ordered a thing for the tent, but it still hasn't come. What am I supposed to do?" The others said, "Second Master is out there. Who dares not give him face?" Xiongfeng said, "You mention him! He also has his own problems. First of all, the money is not under his control. How could he get what he wants?" The others said, "Didn't all the money in the old lady's hands end up with Second Master?" Xiongfeng said, "You should ask the manager to find out." The others said, "No wonder! We've heard men outside complain, 'How can we do anything in such a big affair? We can only do menial work. How can people work together if this is how it is?'"
paragraphs.chinese: 凤姐不敢多说，只好忍着悲和泪离开，又把大家召集起来，又交待了一下，说：“太太们，可怜可怜我吧，我在上面受了不少气，因为你们没有赶到，让上面笑话了，明天你们多费点劲吧。”那些人回答说：“奶奶办事情，不是一次两次了，哪敢不听呢？只是这次事情，上面要求太细了！只说这顿饭吧：有人要来吃，有人要回家吃；请了那位太太，那位奶奶不来。诸如此类，怎么齐全？还求奶奶劝劝姑娘们少挑剔就好了。”凤姐说：“第一难缠的是老太太的丫头，太太的也难说话，叫我说谁去呢？”众人说：“您以前在东府里，还是代理，要打要骂，怎么那么利索？谁敢不依？现在这些姑娘们却压不住了。”凤姐叹气说：“东府里的事，虽说托办的，太太虽然在，不好意思说什么。现在是自己的事情，是公事，人人都能说话。再说，外面的钱也不好使：例如棚子里要一件东西，传出后，总不见拿进来，这叫我怎么办呢？”众人说：“二爷在外面，怕不给面子吗？”凤姐说：“还提这个！他也是有难处。第一，钱不在他手里，要一件得一件，那能办的到？”众人说：“老太太的钱不都在二爷手里吗？”凤姐说：“你们回去问问管事的就知道了。”众人说：“怪不得！我们听见外面的男人抱怨说：这么大事，我们一点也插不上手，净干苦活，怎么叫人能齐心呢？”

paragraphs.original: 凤姐道：“如今不用说了。眼面前的事，大家留些神罢。倘或闹的上头有了什么说的，我可和你们不依。”众人道：“奶奶要怎么样，我们敢抱怨吗？只是上头一人一个主意，我们实在难周到。”凤姐听了也没法，只得央及道：“好大娘们！明儿且帮我一天。等我把姑娘们闹明白了，再说罢了。”众人听命而去。
paragraphs.english: Jing said, "No need to say more, pay attention to what's happening now. If the bosses have something to say, don't blame me." Everyone replied, "Madam, what could we possibly complain about? But everyone has their own ideas, we're really struggling to deal with it." Jing had no other choice but to beg, "Dear aunties, please help me out for a day tomorrow. Let me figure out the girls' problems first, and then I'll talk about it." The group agreed to help, and they left.
paragraphs.chinese: 凤姐说：“不用说了，眼前的事，你们留神吧。万一让上面的人有什么说的，你们可别怪我不依你们。”大家说：“奶奶您要怎么样，我们哪里敢抱怨？可上面的人各有个主意，我们实在应付不过来。”凤姐也没办法，只好央求大家说：“好心的婶子大娘们，明天帮我一天吧。等我把姑娘们的问题弄明白了，再说吧。”众人听她的话便答应着走了。

paragraphs.original: 凤姐一肚子的委屈，愈想愈气，直到天亮，又得上去。要把各处的人整理整理，又恐邢夫人生气；要和王夫人说，怎奈邢夫人挑唆。这些丫头们见邢夫人等不助著凤姐的威风，更加作践起他来。幸得平儿替凤姐排解，说是：“二奶奶巴不得要好，只是老爷太太们吩咐了外头，不许糜费，所以我们二奶奶不能应付到了。”说过几次，才得安静些。
paragraphs.english: In her heart, Lady Wang Xifeng was bitterly aggrieved. The more she thought about it, the angrier she became, until dawn arrived and she had to go back. She had to sort out all the servants, but was afraid that Lady Lin would be displeased. She intended to speak to Lady Wang, but was held back by Lady Lin's scheming. The maids, seeing that Lady Wang Xifeng had no one to back her up, were even more arrogant towards her. Fortunately, Ping'er stood up for Lady Wang Xifeng, explaining, "Actually, Madam Wang Xifeng really wants to get along well with everyone, but the master and mistress have ordered that there must be no waste, so Madam Wang Xifeng is really in a tough spot." Ping'er repeated this several times before Lady Wang Xifeng finally calmed down. (Excerpt from Dream of the Red Chamber)
paragraphs.chinese:
王熙凤心里委屈极了，越想越生气，直到天亮，又得回去。既要整理所有的下人，又怕邢夫人不高兴；想去跟王夫人说，却碍于邢夫人在中间挑拨。这些丫头们见王熙凤没有人在背后撑腰，就更加来作践她。幸好有平儿替王熙凤出头，解释说：“二奶奶其实很想跟大家搞好关系，可是老爷太太们有命令，不许浪费，所以二奶奶实在难办。”平儿这样说了好几次，王熙凤才安静下来。

（节选自《红楼梦》）

paragraphs.original: 虽说僧经道忏，吊祭供饭，络绎不绝，终是银钱吝啬，谁肯踊跃，不过草草了事。连日王妃诰命也来的不少。凤姐也不能上去照应，只好在底下张罗：叫了那个，走了这个；发一回急，央及一回；支吾过了一起，又打发一起。别说鸳鸯等看去不像样，连凤姐自己心里也过不去了。
paragraphs.english:
The monks and Taoist priests chanted scriptures and offered funerary prayers, and many people brought food and other mourning items. There was a steady stream of visitors, much hustle and bustle, but not much of their money was spent. Everyone was stingy and did not want to part with their money. As a result, the arrangements were haphazard and unsatisfactory. Many imperial consorts and title holders also paid their respects, but the Dowager Countess did not have the time to attend to them, so she could only deal with the matter herself. She would call on one person, and the next would leave. She was so anxious that she would stamp her foot in frustration, and then have to use all her charm to persuade people. She had to deal with one problem after another, and it was not just the girls like Jia Qian who were unhappy with this, even the Dowager Countess herself was embarrassed.

The full depth and emotional tone of the original might not fully translate into English due to cultural differences and linguistic nuances, but an attempt has been made to capture the essence and style of the text as faithfully as possible. 

If you have any specific questions about the translation, or need further clarification or adjustments, please let me know! I am here to help.
paragraphs.chinese: 虽然和尚道士诵经拜忏，吊丧祭奠送饭，来来往往，热闹非凡，可白花花的银子花的却很少，谁都小气，不肯多掏钱，事情却做得马马虎虎。连日来王妃和诰命也来了不少，可凤姐儿却没工夫上去应付，只好在底下张罗，叫了这个，那个又走了，一会儿急得直跺脚，一会儿又得下气央求，应付完这个，又得对付那个，别说鸳鸯等人看在眼里心里不是滋味，就是凤姐自己也觉得脸上挂不住。

paragraphs.original: 邢夫人虽说是冢妇，仗著“悲戚为孝”四个字，倒也都不理会。王夫人只得跟著邢夫人行事，馀者更不必说了。独有李纨瞧出凤姐苦处，却不敢替他说话，只自叹道：“俗话说的：‘牡丹虽好，全仗绿叶扶持’，太太们不亏了凤丫头，那些人还帮著吗？若是三姑娘在家还好，如今只有他几个自己的人瞎张罗，背前面后的也抱怨：说是一个钱摸不著，脸面也不能剩一点儿！老爷是一味的尽孝，庶务上头不大明白。这样的一件大事，不撒散几个钱就办的开了么？可怜凤丫头闹了几年，不想在老太太的事上，只怕保不住脸了！”于是抽空儿叫了他的人来，吩咐道：“你们别看著人家的样儿，也糟蹋起琏二奶奶来。别打量什么穿孝守灵就算了大事了，不过混过几天就是了。看见那些人张罗不开，就插个手儿，也未为不可。这也是公事，大家都该出力的。”那些素服李纨的人都答应著说：“大奶奶说的很是，我们也不敢那么著。只听见鸳鸯姐姐们的口话儿，好像怪琏二奶奶的似的。”李纨道：“就是鸳鸯，我也告诉过他。我说琏二奶奶并不是在老太太的事上不用心，只是银子钱都不在他手里，叫他巧媳妇还作的上没米的粥来吗？如今鸳鸯也知道了，所以也不怪他了。只是鸳鸯的样子竟是不像从前了，这也奇怪：那时候有老太太疼他，倒没有作过什么威福；如今老太太死了，没有了仗腰子的了，我看他倒有些气质不大好了。我先前替他愁，这会子幸喜大老爷不在家，才躲过去了；不然，他有什么法儿？”
paragraphs.english:
Translation:

Even though Lady Xing was the senior wife, she relied on her grief over her ancestors' burial to exert influence, and rarely interfered with what Lady Wang Yingzhen did. Lady Wang had to follow Lady Xing's wishes, and the others were even less likely to step in. Only Lady Li Wán could see how hard Lady Wang Yingzhen was working, but she dared not speak out for her, only sighing and saying, "They say that 'Even a beautiful peony needs leaves to support it'. If the ladies don't give face to Lady Wang Yingzhen, who else will help? If Young Miss Yingzhen were still alive, it would be easier, but now, with only her own family members rushing around, they are whispering behind her back, saying that not a single coin is being spent and that she's not even saving face. Father is only focused on his mourning, and doesn't understand the details of the estate. This is a big affair; how can it be handled without spending some money? How unfortunate that Lady Wang Yingzhen has been working so hard for so many years, and now, in her grandmother's passing, she might even not save face!" She then called in some of Lady Wang Yingzhen's loyal attendants and instructed them, "Don't look at how others are behaving and copy them in criticizing Young Master Lin's wife. It's not that mourning and performing rites are big affairs, they're just days to pass. When you see people struggling to organize, you can help them a little bit. This is a matter of duty, and everyone should contribute." The usual attendants who followed Lady Li Wán's instructions agreed, saying, "Mrs. Li is right. We dare not do such a thing. We've only heard that Lady Yüng's maids are criticizing Young Master Lin's wife." Lady Li Wán responded, "Even Lady Yüng, I have spoken with her about this. I said that Young Master Lin's wife isn't neglecting her grandmother's affairs; she's just not in charge of the finances. Even a clever cook can't make porridge with no rice, right? Now, Lady Yüng understands this, so she's not holding a grudge anymore. It's just that Lady Yüng's behavior seems a little strange. This is odd: when her grandmother was alive, she wasn't overbearing; but now, her grandmother is gone, and she seems to have lost her backbone. I was worried about her before, but luckily, since Father isn't home, she's been able to dodge the trouble; otherwise, what could she do?"

paragraphs.chinese: 说着，只见贾兰走来说：“妈妈，休息吧。一天到晚，客人来往的很累人，休息一下吧。这几天我一直没看书。今天爷爷叫我回家睡觉，我很喜欢，要整理一下书本才好，别等脱去孝服就全都忘了。”李纨道：“好孩子，看书自然是好的，今天还是先休息一下吧，等老太太送殡后再看书吧。”贾兰道：“妈妈要睡，我就在床上想一想也行。”众人听了，都夸赞道：“好哥哥！这么小的年纪，就想到书上去了，不像二爷娶了媳妇后还是孩子气：这几日跟着老爷跪着，看他很不舒服，一有机会就跑来找二奶奶，不知道在说什么。甚至搞得二奶奶不理他，他又去找琴姑娘。琴姑娘也躲着他，邢姑娘也不怎么和他说话，倒是本家的喜姑娘、四姑娘，哥哥长，哥哥短的和他很亲密。我们看那二爷除了和奶奶姑娘们混混，只怕他心里也没别的事，白白浪费了老太太的心，疼了他这么大，哪里及得上兰哥儿一点呢！大奶奶将来是不用担心的了。”李纨道：“就这孩子也还小呢，只怕到他大了，咱们家还不知道怎么样呢！环哥儿你们怎么看？”众人道：“哪一个更不像样了！两只眼睛像个活猴子一样，东张西望，西看看。虽然在哀悼，但见了奶奶和姑娘们来了，他在孝幔子里净偷着看人呢！”

paragraphs.original: 李纨道：“他的年纪其实也不小了。前日听见说，还要给他说亲呢，如今又得等著了。嗳！还有一件事：偺们家这些人，我看来也是说不清的！且不必说闲话儿，后日送殡，各房的车是怎么样？”众人道：“琏二奶奶这几天闹的像失魂落魄的样儿了，也没见传出去。昨儿听见外头男人们说：二爷派了蔷二爷料理，说是偺们家的车也不够，赶车的也少，要到亲戚家去借去呢。”李纨笑道：“车也都是借得的么？”众人道：“奶奶说笑话儿了，车怎么借不得？只是那一日所有的亲戚都用车，只怕难借，想来还得雇呢。”李纨道：“底下人的只得雇，上头白车也有雇的么？”众人道：“现在大太太，东府里的大奶奶小蓉奶奶都没有车了，不雇，那里来的呢？”李纨听了，叹息道：“先前见有偺们家里的太太奶奶们坐了雇的车来，偺们都笑话，如今轮到自己头上了！你明儿去告诉你们的男人：我们的车马，早早的预备好了，省了挤。”众人答应了出去。不提。
paragraphs.english: Li Wan said, "He's not young anymore, and it's said that he's being matched up to someone these days. Now there won't be time to do so. There's another thing - I really don't understand our family's affairs! Let's not talk about this nonsense any more. The funeral will be tomorrow, how are we going to deal with the carriages for each family?" They all said, "Madam Linian is going mad these days. I didn't hear anything about how to arrange it. Someone outside said yesterday that Second Master has sent Second Young Master Li to deal with it, saying that our family's carriages and horses are not enough, and there aren't enough drivers. They would have to borrow from relatives. Madam Li Wan laughed and said, "Are all the carriages borrowed?" They all said, "Madam, you're kidding, how could carriages be borrowed? But since all the relatives would be needing carriages on that day, it might be hard to borrow them, and would have to be hired." Li Wan said, "Hired servants' carriages of course would have to be hired. But what about our own carriages and horses?" They all said, "Nowadays, Master, Lady Lin, Lady Li from the East Mansion, and Lady Xiao Rong are all without carriages. If they're not hired, where would they come from?" Li Wan sighed and said, "When I saw the late Madam, Lady Lin, and Lady Li Wan driving their hired carriages, we all ridiculed them. Now it's our turn to experience it! Go and tell your husbands that our carriages and horses must be arranged in advance, so that they don't all end up fighting for one." They all agreed and left. They did not mention this incident again.

paragraphs.english: Let alone that Lady Xiangyun, because her husband was ill and her mother-in-law had died, had only paid one visit, but was now coming to attend the burial because the time was fast approaching. She had to come, she thought, because her husband had Tuberculosis and though the disease was not active, it could strike at any time. Thinking of her mother-in-law's kindness, and the bitter fact that she was a woman of ill-fortune, marrying soon only to find her husband dying of an incurable disease, she felt even more heart-broken and cried all night. She could not stop crying even after the family members, including Yuanyang, had tried to comfort her.
paragraphs.chinese: 再说史湘云因她女婿病重，贾母去世后，只来过一次，现在贾母的葬礼快到了，不得不去。又想起她女婿的病已经是痨病，只是暂时没事，便在葬礼前一天过来。想到贾母对她向来疼爱有加；又想到自己命苦，刚结婚不久，丈夫就得了绝症，恐怕要活不了多久了，于是更加悲伤，直哭了一夜。鸳鸯等人再三劝慰，她仍不能停止哭泣。

paragraphs.original: 宝玉瞅著也不胜悲伤，又不好上前去劝。见他淡妆素服，不敷脂粉，更比未出嫁的时候犹胜几分。回头又看宝琴等也都是淡素妆饰，丰韵嫣然。独看到宝钗浑身挂孝，那一种雅致比寻常穿颜色时更自不同。心里想道：“古人说：千红万紫，终让梅花为魁。看来不止为梅花开的早，竟是那‘洁白清香’四字真不可及了。但只这时候若有林妹妹，也是这样打扮，更不知怎样的丰韵呢！”想到这里，不觉的心酸起来，那泪珠儿便一直的滚下来了，趁著贾母的事，不妨放声大哭。
paragraphs.english: But when he looked at him, he felt very sad in his heart, but he did not have the opportunity to comfort him. He only saw him wearing a simple makeup and dress, not using any cosmetics, and he seemed even more beautiful than when he was not married. When he turned back, he saw that the others like Baqi and the others were also wearing simple makeup, but their beauty remained. He saw that Baizhao was dressed in mourning, and his elegance seemed different from when he wore his usual bright clothes. In his heart, he thought, "Ancient people said: 'A thousand reds and a million violets, the plum blossom always stands at the top.' It seems that it's not just because the plum blossoms bloom early, but even the words 'pure and fragrant' are unattainable. If Lin Er had dressed like this, how enchanting she would have been!" Thinking of this, his heart turned bitter, and his tears kept falling. He couldn't help but cry, using the opportunity of his grandmother's affair.
paragraphs.chinese: 宝玉看着他，心里十分悲伤，又不好上去劝慰。只见他淡妆素服，连脂粉也不用，更比没有出嫁的时候还要清丽几分。回头又看到宝琴等几个，也都是淡妆，丰韵却依旧。只见宝钗浑身挂孝，那一份优雅的气质，比穿平时的艳丽衣服时更显得不同。宝玉心里想道：“古人说：千红万紫，终让梅花为魁。看来不止是因为梅花开得早，就连那‘洁白清香’四个字，都让人难以企及。如果这时候有林妹妹，打扮成这样，那该有多迷人啊！”想到这里，宝玉不禁心酸起来，眼泪也一直往下流，趁着贾母的事，他大哭起来。

paragraphs.original: 众人正劝湘云，外间忽又添出一个哭的人来。大家只道是想著贾母疼他的好处，所以悲伤，岂知他们两个人各自有各自的眼泪？这场大哭，招得满屋的人无不下泪。还是薛姨妈李婶娘等劝住。
paragraphs.english: Everyone was consoling Xiangyun when another person burst into sobs. Everyone thought they were sad about her grandmother’s affection for her. They had no idea that each had a sorrow of her own, and the result was that everyone in the room was moved to tears. Only then did others like Auntie She and Lady Li succeed in calming them down.
paragraphs.chinese: 大家正劝湘云，外间忽然又哭出一个来。大家只以为是为贾母疼她的事伤心，没想到两个人各有一番伤心事，这一场大哭，弄得满屋子的人眼泪都下来了。还是薛姨妈、李婶娘等人将她们劝住了。

paragraphs.original: 次日乃坐夜之期，更加热闹。凤姐这日竟支撑不住，也无方法，只得用尽心力，甚至咽喉嚷哑。敷衍过了半日，到了下半天，亲友更多了，事情也更繁了，瞻前不能顾后。正在著急，只见一个小丫头跑来说：“二奶奶在这里呢！怪不得大太太说：里头人多，照应不过来，二奶奶是躲著受用去了！”凤姐听了这话，一口气撞上来，往下一咽，眼泪直流，只觉得眼前一黑，嗓子里一甜，便喷出鲜红的血来，身子站不住，就蹲倒在地。幸亏平儿急忙过来扶住。只见凤姐的血一口一口的吐个不住。
paragraphs.english: The next day was the day when she was to enter the quarters for the night, and it was even busier than before. Wang Xifeng was unable to hold it together on this day and could do nothing but to exhaust herself, her voice hoarse from shouting. She managed to last until the afternoon, when even more relatives and friends arrived, making the workload even more overwhelming. She was struggling with the workload when she suddenly saw a little servant girl run over and say, "Mrs. Second is here! Just as the First Madam said, there are too many people in the quarters, and she can't keep up with everything. Mrs. Second must have gone off to enjoy her leisure and comfort!" When Wang Xifeng heard this, a burst of anger surged up inside her and she could barely keep it down, her tears streaming down her face. She felt her vision dimming and her throat turning sweet, and she started to spit out bright red blood. She couldn't stand on her own, so she collapsed to the ground. Fortunately, Ping'er rushed over to help her up. Wang Xifeng continued to spit out blood one mouthful after another.
paragraphs.chinese: 第二天就是她坐夜的日子，更加热闹。王熙凤这一天竟然支撑不住，也无可奈何，只好用尽心力，嗓子都喊哑了。应付到半日，到了下午，亲友更多了，事情也更繁了，顾前顾不到后。正在着急，只见一个小丫头跑来说：“二奶奶在这里呢！怪不得大太太说：里头人多，照应不过来，二奶奶是躲着享清福去了！”王熙凤听了这话，一口气撞上来，往下一咽，眼泪直流，只觉得眼前一黑，嗓子里一甜，便喷出鲜红的血来，身子站不住，就蹲倒在地。幸亏平儿急忙过来扶住。只见王熙凤的血一口一口的吐个不停。
